level.text: 833.1 Quarterly reporting periods are as follows: October 1 through December1, January 1 through March 31, April 1 through June 30, and July 1 througheptember 30.
833.2 Each agency shall submit quarterly reports on Department forms withinhirty (30) days after the end of each quarter.

833.3 If an agency cannot include with a quarterly report all the informationequired by the Act, it shall submit with the report a statement and supportingocumentation which establishes good cause for the failure as well as the mannernd time in which the agency will submit the required information.

833.4 If an agency’s quarterly report indicates that the agency is noturrently meeting its SBE contracting and procuring requirements under section341 of the Act and its procurement plan, the agency shall submit with itseport:
The explanation for the contracting shortfall; and
The specific steps it will take to remedy the shortfall, along withupporting documentation.
833.5 The Department shall notify an agency in writing of any deficiencies inhe agency’s quarterly report within thirty (30) days of its receipt ofhe report.
833.6 If an agency’s quarterly report contains deficiencies, theepartment’s notification under § 833.5:
Shall identify the deficiencies in the report and require that theeficiencies be remedied within a stated time period;
May require that the agency submit supporting documentation relating to theequired elements of the report; and
May include recommendations concerning how best to remedy the deficienciesn the report, including attendance at meetings with the Department.

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: Final Rulemaking published at 39 DCR 9052 (December 4, 1992); asmended by Final Rulemaking published at 56 DCR 8439 (October 23, 2009),ncorporating by reference text of Proposed Rulemaking published at 56 DCR 5622,646 (July 10, 2009).
